SectionHeader.h4: AI That Cuts Your Energy Costs – Automatically
SectionHeader.body2: Advanced forecasting and optimization algorithms reduce waste, smooth demand peaks, and slash operational expenses – with no manual work.

button.title: Data Analysis
button.description: SKNN & H-DIRT algorithms detect seasonal patterns and clean data without distorting trends.

block.title: Smart Data Processing
description: Our proprietary SKNN and H-DIRT algorithms go beyond traditional methods, identifying hidden seasonal patterns and filling data gaps without skewing trends.
By applying distance correlation, we capture nonlinear relationships between external factors (like weather) and energy loads—ensuring your models train on perfectly preprocessed data.
No more noise, just precision.

button.title: AI Forecasting
button.description: LSTM, XGBoost & hybrid models adapt to any data for ultra-accurate predictions.

block.title: Adaptive AI Forecasting
description: Not all data behaves the same—so we deploy LSTM, XGBoost, Transformer, and hybrid models to match your unique dynamics.
With temporal encoding and real-time external factors (e.g., temperature), our system self-adjusts for 95%+ accuracy—and scales effortlessly to new assets or timeframes.
Predictions that evolve as fast as your operations do.

button.title: Cost Optimization
button.description: Reduce energy waste by 30%+ with automated demand smoothing and smart procurement.

block.title: Automated Savings
description: Stop overpaying for energy.
Our AI flattens demand spikes, optimizes power purchases, and cuts preprocessing time by 80% via full automation.
From raw data to actionable insights, every step is engineered to boost efficiency across your entire energy chain.
Lower costs, zero manual hassle.

SectionHeader.body2: Clear insights on how our forecasting solutions work—and how they’ll work for you.

Content.question: Will this work with our current data systems?
answer: Our solution integrates via APIs, CSV uploads, or custom connectors—no need to overhaul your existing infrastructure.
Whether you use legacy monitors or modern cloud platforms, we plug in seamlessly.

Content.question: Do we need AI experts to use this?
answer: Upload your data, and our self-tuning models handle the rest.
For advanced users, we offer customization—but 90% of clients run forecasts with just a click.

Content.question: How accurate are your forecasts?
answer: Our hybrid AI (LSTM + XGBoost + Transformer) achieves 95%+ accuracy on energy loads, proven in projects like the University of Brescia. SKNN/H-DIRT algorithms ensure clean data, minimizing errors.

Content.question: Can it scale from a single facility to a city-wide grid?
answer: The same architecture that optimizes office buildings also powers smart cities.
Models auto-adapt to data volume and complexity—no re-engineering needed.

Content.question: How fast can we deploy this?
answer: 48 hours for API integration, 2-4 weeks for full-stack rollout.
Real-time forecasts start updating within 5 minutes of connection.

Content.question: What about data security?
answer: Your data stays encrypted, and we never share it.
On-premise deployment is available for air-gapped systems.

Content.image: /images/images_research/Optimizing Short-Term Electrical Load Forecasting with Bi-LSTM and Advanced Temporal Encoding.webp
Content.title: Optimizing Short-Term Electrical Load Forecasting with Bi-LSTM and Advanced Temporal Encoding
description: This paper presents a new approach to short-term electrical load forecasting, focusing on temporal encoding and minimizing the impact of weather data.
The study found that weather variables had little effect on forecast accuracy, leading to a shift towards encoding time features like minute, hour, and day using sine and cosine transformations.
Advanced machine learning models, including Bi-LSTM and CNN-Bi-LSTM, were tested, with the Bi-LSTM model showing the highest accuracy when combined with the temporal encoding technique.
The findings emphasize the importance of time feature engineering in improving forecast reliability.

Content.image: /images/images_research/Incorporating Seasonal Features in Data Imputation Methods for Power Demand Time Series.webp
Content.title: Incorporating Seasonal Features in Data Imputation Methods for Power Demand Time Series
description: This paper addresses missing data in power demand time series by comparing imputation methods.
It introduces two new approaches: Historical Data Informed Regression (H-DIRT) and Seasonal K-Nearest Neighbors (SKNN).
H-DIRT uses historical data for linear regression, while SKNN adds seasonal trends.
SKNN is more accurate, but H-DIRT is faster for smaller data gaps.
The study shows these methods can improve power demand data accuracy, providing a solid base for future research.

Content.image: /images/images_research/Enhancing Short-Term Load Forecasting through Machine Learning Ensemble Models and by Incorporating Weather Data.webp
Content.title: Enhancing Short-Term Load Forecasting through Machine Learning Ensemble Models and by Incorporating Weather Data
description: Accurate short-term electrical load forecasting is crucial for efficient energy management and grid stability.

This paper presents an advanced ensemble approach for enhancing short-term load forecasting accuracy by integrating Random Forest (RF) and Histogram-based Gradient Boosting Regression (HGBR) algorithms.
The ensemble method leverages the strengths of each algorithm to capture complex patterns and interactions in the data.
Notably, the model incorporates real-world data from the University of Brescia's electrical facility data collection system, adding practical relevance to the study.
Additionally, external weather components, particularly ambient temperature, are included to improve predictive capabilities.

Experimental results demonstrate that the proposed ensemble model significantly outperforms individual forecasting methods in some metrics, achieving higher accuracy and reliability in predicting electrical load.
The inclusion of ambient temperature as an external variable contributes to the enhanced performance, highlighting the importance of weather factors in load forecasting.

Team.education: PhD Student. Major – Systems Analysis, Information Management and Processing, Statistics
